system_message: Generate diverse parameter sets for liquid handling optimization. Focus on combinations likely to achieve good accuracy and precision with different timing characteristics.
- Secondary: Vary timing (operation speed) while maintaining reliability
- Provide distinct parameter combinations with different approaches to accuracy
- CRITICAL: Match your parameter exploration to the liquid's viscosity level
- For low viscosity liquids (~1-10 cP): CENTER exploration toward the FASTER end of speed ranges and SHORTER end of wait ranges
- For medium viscosity liquids (~100-2000 cP): CENTER exploration in the MIDDLE of speed and wait ranges
- For high viscosity liquids (>5000 cP): CENTER exploration toward the SLOWER end of speed ranges and LONGER end of wait ranges
- Ensure parameter values are varied and independent across recommendations
- Create orthogonal parameter combinations to enable clear effect identification
- Each recommendation should explore different parameter space regions
- CRITICAL: Avoid setting multiple parameters to identical values within a single recommendation
- CRITICAL: Vary aspirate_speed, dispense_speed, and wait times independently - don't pair them identically
IMPORTANT: Higher speed values = SLOWER operation (counterintuitive parameter scaling)

exploration_strategy.parameter_independence: MANDATORY - No two timing parameters should have identical values within a recommendation

aspirate_speed.description: Aspiration speed. Higher values = SLOWER speed. Thicker liquids may benefit in some cases.

dispense_speed.description: Dispense speed. Higher values = SLOWER speed. Thicker liquids may benefit in some cases.

aspirate_wait_time.description: Wait time after aspiration. Longer waits may improve accuracy or do nothing. Thicker liquids may benefit in some cases.

dispense_wait_time.description: Wait time after dispensing. Longer waits may improve accuracy or do nothing. Thicker liquids may benefit in some cases.

retract_speed.description: Tip retraction speed. Higher = faster. Only a short part of the protocol.

blowout_vol.description: Air volume blown out after dispensing. Often helpful for squeezing out liquid stuck in the tip.

post_asp_air_vol.description: Air volume aspirated after liquid to prevent dripping.

overaspirate_vol.description: Extra volume aspirated to compensate for tip retention or lack of efficient aspiration of thick liquids.

water.description: Standard aqueous solution, low viscosity (1 cP)

ethanol.description: Low viscosity, volatile liquid (1.2 cP, thinner than water)

4%_hyaluronic_acid_water.description: Very high viscosity polymer solution (10,000-50,000 cP, 10-50x thicker than glycerol)
4%_hyaluronic_acid_water.focus: Very conservative speeds, extended wait times, maximum clearing volumes

DMSO.description: Medium viscosity organic solvent (2 cP, slightly thicker than water)
DMSO.focus: Moderate speeds, short waits, consider volatility
